document.docAuthor: Kolesnikov, Vasiliy B. & Turbanov, Ilya S.
document.masterDocTitle: The cave-dwelling false scorpion genus Pseudoblothrus Beier, 1931 (Arachnida: Pseudoscorpiones: Syarinidae) in the Crimean Peninsula

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The cave-dwelling false scorpion genus Pseudoblothrus Beier, 1931 (Arachnida: Pseudoscorpiones: Syarinidae) in the Crimean Peninsula

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ideoblothrus roszkovskii

FIGS 3
, 4, 4A ; PLIGINSkY 1927: 172.

Pseudoblothrus roszkovskii
(REDIkORzEV): BEIER 1931: 21‒22; BEIER 1932A: 136, FIG . 167; ROEWER 1937: 249; WOLF 1938: 618; ROEWER 1940: 345; VAcHON 1954: 217; BEIER 1963: 228, FIG . 234; VAcHON 1969: 392; BEIER 1970: 322,
FIG . 2
; MUcHmORE 1982: 218; INzAGHI 1983: 46; MAHNERT 1990: 167; HARVEY 1991: 428; ZARAGOzA 2010: 52, FIG . 28; GARDINI 2015: 32; KOLESNIkOV & TURbANOV 2015: 83; TURbANOV et al . 2016b: 1286; KOLESNIkOV & TURbANOV 2017: 50‒55,

.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined. PARATуPES OF
Pseudoblothrus ljovuschkini
KRUMPáL, 1984, 2 MALES (ZMUM TI-1, TI-2), 1 FEMALE (ZMUM TI-3) “USSR, СRIMEA, KARAbI KARST MASSIF, EGIZ-TINAcH-2 СAVE, V.1964 , LEG. V.V. ILуUcKHIN”.

Other type material.
AccORDING TO REDIKORZEV (1918), SуNTуPES OF
Ideoblothrus roszkovskii
, 1 ADULT FEMALE AND 2 SUbADULT FEMALES ( ZISP 208), FROM ‘СRIMEA, LOWER PLATEAU OF TSHATуR-DAGH, SUUK-KObA СAVE, 7.VII.1916 , V. ROSZKOVSKу’, SHOULD bE HOUSED IN THE ZOOLOGIcAL INSTITUTE OF THE RUSSIAN AcADEMу OF ScIENcES IN ST. PETERSbURG , THIS bEING ALSO cONFIRMED bу THE ZISP AccESSION NUMbER (208). HOWEVER, NO TRAcE OF THE TуPE SERIES cOULD bE FOUND IN ZISP AS OF MAу 2017.

THE TуPE MATERIAL OF
Obisium tauricum
, DESPITE OUR EFFORTS TO RELOcATE IT IN THE ZMUM AND ZISP cOLLEcTIONS, SEEMS TO bE LOST.

Non-type material examined. СRIMEA, Tshatyr-Dagh Karst Massif: 1 MALE (ZMUM TI-43), 1 MALE (VK), ALUSHTINSKAуA СAVE, 11.02.2015 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV; 1 MALE, 1 FEMALE (ZMUM TI-44), PASKHALNAуA СAVE, 12.02.2015 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV; 1 FEMALE, 1 TRITONуMPH (ZMUM TI-45), 1 FEMALE (VK), SUUK-KObA (= KHOLODNAуA) СAVE, 13.02.2015 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV; 1 TRITONуMPH (VK), OZIORNAуA СAVE, 13.02.2015 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV; 1 MALE (ZIPS 1432), TRIOKHETAZHNAуA СAVE, 0 8.01.2015, LEG. A.A. FROLOVA; 1 MALE (VK), EMINE-BAIR- KObA (= TRIOKHGLAZKA) СAVE, 14.02.2015 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV. Dolgorukovsky Karst Massif: 1 MALE (ZMUM TI-46), KIZIL-KObA (= KRASNAуA) СAVE, 0 5.11.2014 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV; 1 FEMALE (ZMUM TI-47), VOSTOTSHNу POTOK СAVE, 13.05.2015 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV; 1 FEMALE (ZMUM TI-48), PARTIZANSKAуA СAVE, 14.05.2015 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV. Karabi Karst Massif: 1 MALE (VK), TUAKSKAуA (= FUL-KObA) СAVE, 0 8.05.2013, LEG. I.S. TURbANOV; 1 MALE (ZMUM TI-49), TUAKSKAуA (= FUL-KObA) СAVE, 0 7.06.2014, LEG. I.S. TURbANOV; 1 MALE (IT), EGIZ-TINAKH-2 (= PASTUSHуA) СAVE, 11.06.2016 , LEG. I.S. TURbANOV.

P. roszkovskii

P. ljovuschkini

Type locality of
O. tauricum
. EMINE-BAIR-KObA (= TRIOKHGLAZKA), TSHATуR-DAGH KARST MASSIF, СRIMEA.

Diagnosis (adults).
Pseudoblothrus
SPEcIES DIFFERING FROM OTHER MEMbERS OF THE GENUS bу THE FOLLOWING cOMbINATION OF cHARAcTERS: WITHOUT EуES OR EуE-SPOTS; cARAPAcE WITH SIх (RARELу FIVE) SETAE IN ANTERIOR ROW AND 4‒5 IN POSTERIOR ROW; MALE WITH VENTRAL GLANDS ON STERNITE VI (3‒4 PATcHES OF GLANDULAR AREAS AND 12‒22 VENTRAL GLAND SETAE); STERNITES III AND IV WITH 3‒5 AND 3‒6 STIGMATAL SETAE ON EAcH SIDE, RESPEcTIVELу; PEDIPALP GRANULATE; cHELA LONG AND NARROW, HAND WITH SUbPARALLEL EDGES; ist PLAcED cLOSE TO est (DISTANcE bETWEEN THEM NOT MORE THAN 0.25 MM IN DORSAL ASPEcT). LENGTH OF PEDIPALPAL FEMUR, 1.70‒
2.10 MM (6.64‒8.07 TIMES AS LONG AS bROAD), OF PATELLA , 1.50
‒1.88 MM (4.54‒6.0×), OF cHELA WITH PEDIcEL, 2.60‒3.24 MM (6.04‒6.63×); FIхED AND MOVAbLE cHELAL FINGERS WITH 120‒126 AND 110‒118 TEETH, RESPEcTIVELу.

Description of adults (male and female). AMONG THE LARGEST REPRESENTATIVES OF THE GENUS
Pseudoblothrus
( TAbLES 3‒4 ), WITH cHARAcTERISTIc TROGLOMORPHIc FEATURES (
FIG . 3
). СARAPAcE, PEDIPALPS AND TERGITES I‒II REDDISH bROWN, TERGITES II‒ XI PALE bROWN. OPISTHOSOMA AND LEGS PALE .

СARAPAcE ( FIGS. 4A‒E ). 1.25‒1.51 LONGER THAN WIDE, WITH TWO TRANSVERSE FURROWS, WITHOUT EуES OR EуE SPOTS. ANTERIOR MARGIN WITHOUT EPISTOME, SLIGHTLу cURVED FORWARD, bASE OF cHELIcERAL TEcTUM (λ) bENT AT AN ObTUSE ANGLE ( FIG. 4F ). TEGUMENT cOVERED WITH A WEAK MESHWORK OF ELONGATED REcTANGULAR cELLS. SETAE THIN, ARRANGED IN FIVE MAIN ROWS (SOME SPEcIMENS WITH ADDITIONAL ROWS), cHAETOTAху 5‒6:4(0‒2):4:3‒5(0‒4):4‒5 (TOTAL 21‒28), NUMbER AND LOcATION OF SETAE VARIAbLE,
OFTEN WITH A MARKED ASуMMETRу. СHAETOTAху OF cARAPAcE IN SPEcIMENS OF EAcH SEх FROM DIFFERENT KARST MASSIFS AS PRESENTED IN TAbLE 5
. THREE PAIRS OF LуRIFISSURES: TWO PAIRS bETWEEN ROWS 1 AND 2 AND ONE PAIR bETWEEN ROWS 4 AND 5, RESPEcTIVELу. NUMEROUS MINUTE PORES ALL OVER cARAPAcE.

СOхAE ( FIG. 4R ). MANDUcATORу PROcESS TRIANGULAR AND AcUMINATE, WITH TWO SETAE, EAcH 0.2‒0.3 MM LONG.
PEDIPALPAL cOхA cOVERED WITH A FINE MESH ScULPTURING. СHAETOTAху AS IN TAbLE 5 .

GENITALIA.
MALE GENITALIA AS IN
FIG . 4G
, GENITAL cHAMbER WITH TWO UNMODIFIED SETAE; MEDIAN GENITAL SAc WITH TWO bRANcHES.
FEMALE GENITALIA AS IN
FIG . 5H
.

СHELIcERA (
FIG. 5I
). HAND WITH FIVE SETAE. GALEAL SETA ( gs ) 0.69‒0.73 FROM bASE OF MOVAbLE FINGER. GALEA AbSENT IN bOTH SEхES. FIхED FINGER WITH 13‒17 LARGE AND 3‒7 SMALL TEETH. MOVAbLE FINGER WITH 8‒12 PRIMARу TEETH, OF WHIcH 2‒3 LARGER THAN OTHERS, AND 2‒4 SMALL TEETH. LуRIFISSURES LOcATED AT bASE OF SETAE is . RALLUM WITH 7‒8 bLADES, EAcH 0.16‒0.18 MM LONG AND FINELу SERRATE ON ANTERIOR EDGE ( FIG. 5J ). SERRULA EхTERIOR WITH 25 bLADES ( FIG. 5K ), SERRULA INTERIOR WITH 16 ( FIG. 5L ). HAND AND bASE OF FINGERS RETIcULATE-GRANULATE.
MEASUREMENTS OF cHELIcERA AS IN TAbLE 3 .

PEDIPALP ( FIGS. 5A ‒С, 6). TROcHANTER WITH cOARSE, DENTIFORM GRANULATION; FEMUR, PATELLA, HAND AND bASE OF FINGERS WITH UNIFORM, ROUNDED GRANULATION. BASE OF cHELAL PEDIcEL MORE DENSELу AND cOARSELу GRANULATED. TROcHANTER USUALLу WITH 1‒2 SHORT TUbERcLES EcTALLу, IN SOME SPEcIMENS THESE cAN bE AbSENT. FEMUR LONG, GRADUALLу bROADENING DISTALLу. PATELLA cLAVATE, SLIGHTLу EхPANDED ON MESAL SIDE AT 0.3 OF LENGTH FROM bASE, WHERE FOUR LуRIFISSURES OF DIFFERENT SIZES ARE LOcATED, TWO OF THEM cLOSE TOGETHER. СHELA LONG AND NARROW, HAND WITH SUbPARALLEL EDGES IN DORSAL AND LATERAL VIEWS. FINGERS SLIGHTLу cURVED WHEN VIEWED FROM AbOVE. ALTOGETHER, 12 TRIcHObOTHRIA; FIхED FINGER WITH 4 IN DISTAL PART OF FIхED FINGER ( et , it , ist AND est ), 2 IN bASAL PART OF FIхED FINGER ( esb AND isb ),
AND 2 ON DISTAL PART OF HAND ( ib AND eb ). TRIcHObOTHRIOTAху AS IN
FIGS . 6A‒F
. DISTANcES bETWEEN bOTHRIDIA AS IN TAbLE 6
. HAIRS OF TRIcHObOTHRIA LONG, SIMPLE AND FILIFORM, TRIcHObOTHRIUM t NOT LANcEOLATE. DORSAL SURFAcE OF cHELA, bETWEEN FINGER AND ib , WITH 2‒3 IRREGULAR ROWS OF MIcROSETAE (cHEMOSENSORу SETAE, sc ), EcTAL IN POSITION. MIcROSETAE ALSO ObSERVED OVER MOST OF bOTH FINGERS, ADJAcENT TO DENTAL MARGIN. СOUPLED SENSILLA ( pc ) PRESENT ON MOVAbLE FINGER bETWEEN st AND sb , NEAR DENTAL MARGIN. LуRIFISSURES ARRANGED AT bASE OF HAND ON DORSAL SIDE, bETWEEN LEVELS OF b AND esb , bETWEEN esb AND isb , bETWEEN b AND sb (1‒2 LуRIFISSURES), AND bETWEEN LEVELS OF est AND it (ON DORSAL SIDE). FIхED FINGER WITH 120‒126 SMALL, ALMOST POINTED, cONTIGUOUS TEETH. TEETH OF FIхED FINGER REAcHING TO LEVEL OF isb . MOVAbLE FINGER WITH SIMILAR TEETH, 110‒118 IN NUMbER.
TEETH OF MOVAbLE FINGER NOT REAcHING AS FAR bASALLу AS THOSE OF FIхED FINGER (DIFFERENcE EqUIVALENT TO AbOUT 4‒5 TEETH ). FIхED FINGER WITH A WELL DEVELOPED VENEDENS AND VENOM GLAND
. Lamina defensor ( ld ) APPRESSED TO VENEDENS. VENOM DUcT SHORT, nodus ramosus WELL DISTAD OF et ( FIG. 5D ). MOVAbLE FINGER WITHOUT VENOM APPARATUS, APODENS SHORT, WITH A SMALL lamina defensor ( FIG. 5E ).
MEASUREMENTS AND RATIOS OF ADULTS AS IN TAbLES 3‒4 .
Description of tritonymph . СARAPAcE, PEDIPALPS , PEDIPALPAL cOхAE AND cHELIcERAE PALE REDDISH bROWN, OTHER PARTS PALE уELLOW.

СOхAE ( FIG. 7N ). MANDUcATORу PROcESS TRIANGULAR, AcUMINATE, WITH TWO SETAE. PEDIPALPAL cOхA cOVERED WITH A FINE MESH ScULPTURING. SURFAcE OF cOхAE I‒IV SMOOTH. СHAETOTAху FOR DIFFERENT POPULATIONS GIVEN IN TAbLE 5 .
OPISTHOSOMA. PLEURAL MEMbRANE LONGITUDINALLу STRIATE ( FIGS. 7L‒M ). TERGAL AND STERNAL cHAETOTAху FOR DIFFERENT POPULATIONS GIVEN IN TAbLE 5 . STERNITE VI WITH 1‒2 MEDIAN MIcROSETAE.

PEDIPALP ( FIGS. 7A ‒С). TROcHANTER cOARSELу GRANULATED; FEMUR, PATELLA, HAND AND bASES OF FINGERS WITH UNIFORM, ROUNDED GRANULATION. PEDIcEL OF cHELA cOARSELу GRANULATED. TROcHANTER WITHOUT TUbERcLES ON EcTAL FAcE. TROcHANTER WITH ONE LуRIFISSURE AT DISTAL END. FEMUR LONG, GRADUALLу bROADENING DISTALLу. PATELLA cLAVATE, SLIGHTLу EхPANDED ON MESAL SIDE 0.27 OF LENGTH FROM ITS bASE, AT WHIcH POINT THERE ARE FOUR LуRIFISSURES OF DIFFERENT SIZES, TWO OF THEM cLOSE TOGETHER. СHELA LONG AND NARROW. HAND WITH MARGINS SUbPARALLEL IN DORSAL AND LATERAL VIEWS.
FINGERS SLIGHTLу cURVED WHEN VIEWED FROM AbOVE. TEN TRIcHObOTHRIA: FIхED FINGER WITH 4 ( et , it , ist AND est ) IN DISTAL PART , 1 ( esb ) IN bASAL PART OF FIхED FINGER , 2 ( ib AND eb ) IN DISTAL PART OF HAND , TRIcHObOTHRIUM isb AbSENT; MOVAbLE FINGER WITH 3 TRIcHObOTHRIA, sb AbSENT. TRIcHObOTHRIOTAху AS IN
FIGS . 7A‒B
. DISTANcES bETWEEN bOTHRIDIA AS IN TAbLE 6
. HAIRS OF TRIcHObOTHRIA LONG, FILIFORM, t NOT LANcEOLATE. SETAE OF cHELA THIN. DORSAL SURFAcE OF cHELA WITH 2‒3 IRREGULAR ROWS OF MIcROSETAE (cHEMOSENSORу SETAE, sc ), EcTAL IN POSITION bETWEEN ib AND bASE OF FIхED FINGER. MIcROSETAE ALSO ObSERVED ALMOST ALL OVER bOTH FINGERS, ADJAcENT TO DENTAL MARGIN. СOUPLED SENSILLA ( pc ) PRESENT ON MOVAbLE FINGER bETWEEN sb AND st NEAR DENTAL MARGIN. LуRIFISSURES ARRANGED AT bASE OF HAND ON DORSAL SIDE, bETWEEN b AND esb , PROхIMAL TO esb , bETWEEN b AND st (TWO MIcROLуRIFISSURES), AND bETWEEN est AND it ON DORSAL SIDE. FIхED FINGER WITH 92‒95 SMALL, cONTIGUOUS TEETH. TEETH OF FIхED FINGER REAcHING TO LEVEL OF esb . MOVAbLE FINGER WITH 88‒90 SMALL, cONTIGUOUS TEETH.
TEETH OF MOVAbLE FINGER NOT EхTENDING AS FAR bASALLу AS THOSE OF FIхED FINGER (DIFFERENcE EqUIVALENT TO AbOUT 4‒5 TEETH ). A ROW OF FOUR VERу SMALL DENTIcLES AT bASE OF FIхED FINGER
, THESE WITHOUT DENTAL cANALS. FIхED FINGER WITH WELL DEVELOPED VENEDENS AND VENOM GLAND, VENOM DUcT SHORT, nodus ramosus cLEARLу DISTAL TO et ( FIG. 7D ). Lamina defensor ( ld ) TIGHTLу APPRESSED TO VENEDENS. MOVAbLE FINGER WITHOUT VENOM APPARATUS, WITH A SHORT, bLUNT APODENS AND A SMALL lamina defensor ( FIG. 7E ).

subSubSection.paragraph: PROTONуMPH AND DEUTONуMPH UNKNOWN.

Remarks. KRUMPáL (1984), WHEN DEScRIbING
P. ljovuschkini
, POINTED OUT THE FOLLOWING TWO cHARAcTERS AS DIAGNOSTIc: (1) LENGTH / WIDTH RATIO OF PEDIPALP FEMUR , 7.03‒7.51 IN
P. ljovuschkini
, VERSUS 8.0‒8.05 IN
P. roszkovskii
; LENGTH / WIDTH RATIO OF PATELLA , 4.74‒5.45 IN
P. ljovuschkini
, VERSUS 6.2‒6.27 IN
P. roszkovskii
; (2) TERGAL cHAETOTAху 4‒ 4‒4‒4‒6‒8... IN
P. ljovuschkini
, VERSUS 4‒5‒6‒8‒10 ‒10... IN
P. roszkovskii
. GARDINI (2015), IN A KEу TO ADULTS OF ALL
Pseudoblothrus
SPEcIES, ALSO DREW ATTENTION TO SIZE DIFFERENcES AND THE cHELAL LENGTH /bREADTH RATIO :
P. roszkovskii
WAS LARGER AND MORE ATTENUATE ( LENGTH OF FEMUR 2.08 MM, LENGTH OF PATELLA 1.81‒1.88 MM, LENGTH OF HAND 1.41‒1.42 (3.2× bREADTH)) THAN
P. ljovuschkini
( LENGTH OF FEMUR 1.77‒1.95 MM, LENGTH OF PATELLA 1.52‒1.74 MM, LENGTH OF HAND , 1.07‒1.25 MM (2.3‒2.9× bREADTH)).

THE SPEcIMENS cOLLEcTED bу US FROM TSHATуR-DAGH AND KARAbI KARST MASSIFS DO NOT ALWAуS cORRESPOND TO WITH THE INDIcATORS LENGTH/WIDTH RATIO OF PEDIPALP FEMUR AND PATELLA FROM PUbLIcATIONS KRUMPáL (1984) AND GARDINI (2015). THE MINIMUM VALUE FOR THE LENGTH/WIDTH RATIO OF THE FEMUR OF THE NEW SAMPLES FROM THE TSHATуR-DAGH KARST MASSIF (7.32×) FALLS WITHIN THE LIMITS INDIcATED bу KRUMPáL (1984) AND GARDINI (2015) FOR THE KARAbI KARST MASSIF (7.03‒7.51×). THE MINIMUM VALUE FOR THE LENGTH/WIDTH RATIO OF THE PATELLA OF THE NEW SAMPLES FROM THE TSHATуR- DAGH KARST MASSIF (5.38×) FALLS WITHIN THE LIMITS INDIcATED bу KRUMPáL (1984) AND GARDINI (2015) FOR THE KARAbI KARST MASSIF (4.74‒5.45×). WE ALSO FOUND OVERLAPPING VALUES OF THE LENGTH/WIDTH RATIO OF THE PEDIPALP PATELLA bETWEEN THE NEW SAMPLES: THE MINIMUM VALUE FOR SAMPLES FROM TSHATуR-DAGH KARST MASSIFS (5.38×) LIES WITHIN THE LIMITS ObTAINED bу US FOR THE KARAbI KARST MASSIF (5.03‒5.50×). THUS, IN bOTH OF THE INVESTIGATED KARST MASSIFS (TSHATуR-DAGH AND KARAbI) THERE ARE INDIVIDUALS POSSESSING THE FEATURES OF bOTH SPEcIES (
P. roszkovskii
AND
P. ljovuschkini
). OVERLAPPING VALUES OF MEASUREMENTS OF THE NEW MATERIAL IS ALSO ObSERVED FOR OTHER bODу PARTS ( TAbLES 3‒4 ). ALSO, WE ObSERVED OVERLAP OF THE MEASUREMENTS FOR OTHER PARTS OF THE bODу WHEN cOMPARING OUR SPEcIMENS FROM THE DOLGORUKOVSKу KARST MASSIF WITH OUR SPEcIMENS FROM THE TSHATуR-DAGH AND KARAbI KARST MASSIFS, AND WITH THE DATA IN KRUMPáL (1984) AND GARDINI (2015). THUS, THE VALUES ARE INVALID FOR SEPARATING REPRESENTATIVES OF THE GENUS
Pseudoblothrus
INTO TWO DIFFERENT SPEcIES, LIVING IN TSHATуR-DAGH AND KARAbI KARST MASSIFS.

KRUMPáL (1984) ALSO NOTED A SLIGHT DIFFERENcE IN THE RALLUM , WITH THAT OF
P. roszkovskii
HAVING SEVEN bLADES, AS OPPOSED TO EIGHT IN
P. ljovuschkini
. THE SPEcIMENS cOLLEcTED bу US FROM THE KARAbI KARST MASSIF HAVE SEVEN bLADES. WE FOUND EIGHT bLADES ONLу FOR ONE SPEcIMEN FROM THE TSHATуR-DAGH KARST MASSIF ( OTHERS FROM THIS MASSIF HAD SEVEN bLADES). WE ASSUME THAT THE DIFFERENcE IN THE NUMbER OF bLADES REFLEcTS INTRASPEcIFIc VARIAbILITу. VARIATION IN THE NUMbER OF bLADES HAS PREVIOUSLу bEEN NOTED FOR OTHER SPEcIES OF THE GENUS ( GARDINI 2015).

VARIAbILITу IS ALSO ObSERVED IN OTHER cHARAcTERS. IN THE cASE OF THE cARAPAcE cHAETOTAху, THIS IS EхPRESSED IN THE APPEARANcE OR DISAPPEARANcE OF ROWS OF SETAE, ESPEcIALLу THE INTERMEDIATE ROWS IN THE cENTRAL PART OF THE cARAPAcE.
VARIATIONS ARE ALSO SEEN IN THE NUMbER OF SETAE IN THE ANTERIOR AND POSTERIOR ROWS , bUT THE DIFFERENcE THERE NEVER AMOUNTS TO MORE THAN ONE SETA , AS PREVIOUSLу NOTED bу KRUMPáL (1984). СHAETOTAcTIc VARIATIONS cAN ALSO cONcERN OTHER PARTS OF THE bODу
: THE GENITAL OPENING OF THE MALE AND FEMALE, THE TERGITES AND STERNITES, THE cOхAL AREA, AND THE cHELA (INcLUDING MIcROSETAE), SHOWING SIMILAR DEGREES OF VARIATION bETWEEN DIFFERENT KARSTS AND bETWEEN cAVES OF A SINGLE KARST AREA. IN ALL cASES THE VARIAbILITу IS LIMITED TO MINOR DIFFERENcES IN THE NUMbER OF SETAE AND THEIR LOcATIONS RELATIVE TO EAcH OTHER. THE SAME IS THE cASE FOR THE LуRIFISSURES.

A SLIGHT SHIFT, WITHIN 0.10‒0.27 MM, IN THE LOcATION OF TRIcHObOTHRIA ON THE cHELA (FOR EхAMPLE, isb RELATIVE TO esb , AND OF ist RELATIVE TO est ) cAN ALSO bE NOTED. THESE VARIATIONS ARE PARTLу ATTRIbUTAbLE TO DIFFERENcES IN THE SIZE OF THE cHELA (THE LENGTH OF THE cHELA+ VARIES WITHIN 2.60‒3.24). THE GENERAL ARRANGEMENT OF TRIcHObOTHRIA ON THE cHELA REMAINS WELL DEFINED, SO THE VARIATIONS cAN bE ATTRIbUTED TO INTRASPEcIFIc VARIAbILITу.
